category: hydraulic fluid or oil leak, foot or leg injury
text: hydraulic tensioning machine tensioning head pulled of stud as it was not fully engaged.  no injuries migrated from legacy cairs incident #30802work was part of the molecular sieve change out shutdown. work was on dehydrator bed 4task being undertaken was tensioning bolts on the outlet flange using a hydraulic tensioning machinework crew consisted ofclient senior mechanical technician,client maintenance technician 2 (original permit holder (ph), wg maintenance supplement labour x 2client maintenance tech 2 wanted to clarify the tensioning values on the bolts so left the worksite to verify in the office. bolts are in pattern a, b, a, b and so on. a bolts have a different tension value to b boltsclientmaintenance tech 2 left clear instructions to client sen mech tech and wg x 2 not to do any tensioning until he returnedclient sen mech tech ignored this instruction and the moved forward with the tensioning. wg personnel spoke up explaining they were not to work however they were ignored. during the task that followed, undertaken by client personnel only, one of the tensioning heads was not engaged properly on a stud and it pulled off resulting in the tensioning head dropping to grade (est 1m above, refer photos in attachment). minor hydraulic fluid leak also occurred.wg involvement as assistant labour to mechanical technicians. wg personnel were not operating the hydraulic tensioning machine. (l02nm, irat 100) migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

driver entering underground car park when door lowered damaging roof antenna on vehicle migrated from legacy cairs incident #33825driver entering underground car park when door lowered damaging roof antenna on vehicle migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

the ip was working inside the robot cell carrying out a routine task when stood up his hard hat caught the sealer nozzle which caused neck to jerk back. at this point the ip lay down on the floor and waited for assistance. migrated from legacy cairs incident #38134ipwas working inside the robot cell carrying out a routine task when stood up his hard hat caught the sealer nozzle which caused neck to jerk back. at this point kevin lay down on the floor and waited for assistance. kevin suffered minor cut to his during this time, unsure what caused the cut.ipwas attend by first aiders until the ambulance arrived to take him to hospital for assessment.iphad follow the correct procedure for entering the cell and had the correct ppe according to our rams.fox safety were notified of the incident and attend site with 5 minutes. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

suspected foreign body in left eye  whilst entering into fab shop, water from tarp roof fell onto hardhat  and inside safety glasses  ip walked over to the bilfinger site offices where he was assisted by a aamecfw first aider who washed his left eye

employee communicated a positive confirmation for covid-19  an employee reported a confirmed positive test for covid-19 to site management. the employee has been in isolation since february 17th. wood is identifying those who may have worked in proximity.  appropriate notifications have been completed. this is the second positive result for the 22nd  of february.

wood team member tested positive for covid-19 wood team member received a positive test result for covid 19, a wood team member's friend tested positive for covid19, experiencing mild symptoms. as a result, the team member took a test and received a positive result for covid 19. team member is experiencing mild symptoms. team member, reported to hssesome recommendations were sent to the employee by hsse

employee driving a wood vehicle gor rear-ended while driving southbound on 214 north main st. in chase city, va the affected employee was rear-ended while driving a company issued vehicle southbound on north main street in chase city, va. the incident occurred at approximately 0715. weather conditions were overcast, and roads were dry. no injuries were reported. there is moderate damage to driver’s side rear bumper, tail lights, quarter panel, and tailpipe. the incident was reported to the local police department and wood site superintendent. the officer on scene determined that the other driver was at fault for following too close. the affected employee wasreleased from the scene and immediately received a medical evaluation from onsite emt and was released back to work.			 the local police department and wood management was notify of the accident.  wood employee was evaluated by the onside emt, and then released to go back to work with no further issues.  an investigation was initiated.

while welding a flangeolet onto the maintenance flare system, the work party heard a burst of air under pressure coming from the pilot hole, felt heat from the air and personal monitor was activated. no injuries or asset damage. migrated from legacy cairs incident #39850on tuesday 2nd october 2018 work was underway to install a branch fitting for a flow transmitter on an 8" line flowing from the maintenance flare knockout drum to the maintenance flare. this was a scope of work outlined by shell, designed by wood psdp from the galway office, and controlled by wood pscs at bbgt. all perimetry and associated method statement risk assessments were developed by the wood site team. shell implemented isolations associated with the task and approved the permit to work submitted by wood. the work involved drilling a 34mm diameter hole into the 8” line and then welding a fitting (flangeolet) on top of this hole to facilitate the installation of the flow transmitter. after the 34mm hole had been drilled into the line and the initial tacking of the fitting was completed, final welding of the fitting commenced. after about 2 minutes into the welding operation a sudden single burst of pressurised warm air came out through the 34mm hole which was heard and heat haze was seen by the work party. work was stopped immediately, and the work party left the habitat and reported the incident to the control room. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

theft over the weekend of plastic water sprayers on site from outside of the cabin theft over the weekend of plastic water sprayers (used to dampen soil) left outside of site cabin over the weekend  get replacement water sprayers to continue work. discussion on placing the sprayers inside the cabin over the weekend and overnight reorganising the packing of the cabin.

high voltage cable stolen from laydown area  approximately 185 meters of high voltage cable was stolen after thieves cut through the site laydown perimeter fencing  and removed 185 meters of cable from its drum scene of theft  secured, gent police informed and perimeter fencing repaired

during installation of cable tray, an led light fell off its support causing the pyro cable to snap and arc before burning through . at about 12:50pm wood e&i technicians were installing a new cable ladder in the fccu pump alley at the n/s pipe rack end. there was an led light fitting in the way of the cable ladder install so the workers unscrewed and lowered the fitting and supported it. the light was left energised during this process as no electrical work was required on the light or its circuit. the light fell off its support and dropped, and the weight of the light and bracket snapped the pyro supply cable. this caused an arc which subsequently burned through the cable. no one was in the immediate vicinity at the time and no one was injured.  the light was isolated after the incident and subsequently repaired. circuit isolated and incident reported. light repaired and put back into service to ensure adequate lighting for night shift.

ip felt slight burning sensation on back of wrist ip felt slight burning sensation on back of wrist.  the ip has stated that he was wearing gloves on the outside of his green chemical suit.  this is the incorrect standard.  it is believed that a small amount of acid liquor dropped onto ips suit.  it then ran down his suit sleeve and made contact with skin on the back of his wrist. completed his normal duties until he could no longer stand the pain. he then come out of area 200 and went to the toilet to start to wash the effective area with water. this incident was then reported to a local supervisor who then alerted the plant control room.  first aid was given by the emergency response team.

construction of the access track to d23 has been undertaken prior to the pre-commencement checklist being signed off.  construction of the access track to d23 has been undertaken prior to the pre-commencement checklist being signed off. the usual protocol has not been followed. this has not resulted in any harm to the environment / local ecology.note – there are no photographs of access track to add to notification. works stopped.

employee stung by bee. migrated from legacy cairs incident #34753employee was by "white board", honey bee was noticed flying around, employee attempted to get out of area, bee flew into shirt sleeve, stung employee's right forearm. employee notified safety immediately. redness & swelling noticed, employee also stated he is allergic to bee stings. client's protocol was followed by notifying ert's, was instructed to go to onsite nurse. sting swab applied, observed for 30 minutes, no further complications. employee returned to work. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

2 company trucks parked in the fc yard had the gas tanks punctured and the gasoline stolen.  it was discovered that 2 company trucks had the gas tanks punctured and the gasoline stolen out of the tanks. it’s believed the incident occurred between 1730 on 4/28 & 0545 on 4/29 due to nobody being in the yard. these trucks were parked in our fenced in yard and no evidence of break in was found. one of the trucks had the gas tank door left open and a cap for water jug on the ground next to it. district equipment manager notified safety and local law enforcement. all trucks that are parked in the yard have been moved to a lighted area where cameras can view them.

ip sustained a minor scald to their right shin. on thursday 5th december at 0530 am whilst engaging in an offsite (campsite) cultural immersion experience as part of the company reconciliation action plan, the ip sustained a minor burn to their right shin.hot water had been provided in a metal mug to prepare tea. the ip rested the mug on a hard plastic table top that had not been adequately erected level. the mug slid towards the ip and tipped off the table emptying the contents down the right leg of the ip.this resulted in a scald to the right shin that was treated immediately with ice and water. no medical treatment was sought, although it was available within the area.immediate corrective action taken to cover the table drink preparation area with cloths to prevent a re-occurrence.no further action necessary other than to feedback lessons learned to the event organisers. water and ice applied. no further  medical treatment was sought, although it was available within the area.immediate corrective action taken to cover the table drink preparation area with cloths to prevent a re-occurrence.no further action necessary other than to feedback lessons learned to the event organisers.

discharge of compressed air from ba bottle while sea fastening a pallet of breathing apparatus bottles for backload, one of the bottles suffered an immediate fracture at the release valve.a rapid discharge of compressed air occurred allowing the bottle to strike the container a number of times and eventually coming to rest externally on the walkway immediately after the incident he made the area safe and contacted the deck foreman who instructed him to visit the medic.the dunlin medic administered first aid and prescribed anti-inflammatory drugs. he placed the ip on light duties for the remainder of the shift.individual was declared fit to undertake full deck duties the following morning at 07:30, upon advice from the topside doctor.investigation commenced

ip was walking from the seafox 7 gangway onto the apu deck and tripped on a threaded bolt  on the 1st of april at 16:00 ip was walking from the seafox 7 gangway onto the apu deck and tripped on a threaded bolt approx. 15mm long and landed on both knees, after this incident occurred the ip thought the pain was bearable and continued to work for that day. the ip woke up on the morning of the 2nd feeling some discomfort and decided to visit the seafox 2 medic at 10:30am he was assessed and given ibuprofen and paracetamol for pain relief and returned to work.  1.	ip removed bolt from area2.	ip visited seafox 2 medic following day3.	medic assessed and prescribed ibuprofen and paracetamol

category: hand or arm injury, foot or leg injury
text: subcontractor worker stumbled exiting excavator, striking arm on post causing laceration that required sutures a subcontractor worker stepped off of an excavator track, landing his right leg on the ground. while stepping backwards with his left leg, away from the equipment, his left leg entered a finger trench for a control motor post causing him to fall backwards, striking his right arm on the top of the post which resulted in a laceration requiring sutures injured worker transported to medical facility, where he received sutures and rx medication.
the wood subcontractor was tested positive during the monitoring at the hotel. the wood subcontractor was tested positive during the monitoring at the hotel. isolation and medical recommendation

1 x wood employee tested positive for covid-19 1 x ip felt ill over the weekend, had a positive lft result on 09/01/22, followed by a positive pcr test result on 10/01/22. ip received isolation note from nhs. will isolate at home for instructed period.

employee communicated a positive confirmation for covid-19  an employee reported a confirmed positive test for covid-19 to site management. the employee has been in isolation since october 13th. wood is identifying those who may have worked in proximity.  appropriate notifications have been completed. this is the fourteenth positive result for the 14th of october.

category: mechanical or equipment issue, slips & trips
text: a pvc pipe and slip flange joint separated during startup of the plant.  pvc glued pipe joint separated during startup of new system installation. a blind was left in a different part of the line and caused an over pressurization of the system resulting in in the pipe slipping out of the glued slip flange joint. investigation into whether or not the joint was ever glued is underway.  initial cause of failure was determined to be a blind, removed blind and repaired the pipe to return to service. investigation into whether or not the joint was actually glued is being conducted.

ie walked under a well and his neck was scratched by equipment. while making rounds operator was passing by the a-15 well going towards the compressor building. he walked underneath the well and scratched the back of his neck on the pressure relief fitting on the sdv diaphragm. actual is b1 due to injury being a scratch requiring a band-aid. potential is b1 due to the fitting could only produce a scratch that would still only require first aid treatment.  cleaned scratch and applied a band-aid and neosporin. employee returned to work. monitoring condition.

company medical standards not adhered to as part of engagement serikani (managed contractor) sent a banksman offshore, assurance check conducted by hsse established the employee did not have a current ukoa offshore medical nor any screening for communicable diseases. afw had previously provided specific criteria as part of the contract call off.  individual scheduled for de-mob from facility as soon as crew boat is able to take the unscheduled passenger.follow up meeting to be held with the managed contractor, viewing as a non conformance to contract conditions.

category: vehicle incident general, hand or arm injury
text: employee was involved in a mva resulting in a roll over bruising her hand while traveling west on hwy 42 near wichita, ks, in route to the flat ridge wind farm, employee approached a slow moving farm truck. with no oncoming traffic, employee signaled and began to pass the farm truck to the left. while actively passing, the truck driver signaled left and began an abrupt left turn. employee began to speed up in an attempt to avoid contact with truck. once the pass was complete and while returning to the right lane employee left the roadway. employee was unable to regain control and the vehicle and upon leaving the road the vehicle rolled over one time. kansas state police and an ambulance responded. employee was transported to an area hospital for evaluation. upon completion of tests and evaluation, employee was released with no injuries.  a stand down was held with all wind employees to discuss incident and potential driving hazards. the project manager went to the location to assist employee and aid in the investigation.

wood employee was in monitoring pre-embark to whp-a, performed the covid-19 test on january 6th and the result was positive wood employee was in monitoring pre-embark to whp-a, performed the covid-19 test on january 6th and the result was positive. the ip is asymptomatic. the employee is asymptomatic. the ip was kept in the hotel and will be sent home for a quarantine period.

person tested positive to sars-cov-2 on arrival to site.  person tested positive to sars-cov-2 on arrival to site. placed into isolation for at least 10 days placed into isolation for at least 10 days

neck strain employee was lifting buckets of wet concrete and then pouring the concrete from height.  while performing this task a second time the employee felt a strain on the right side of the neck. employee contacted workcare and was given self-care, first-aid advice.  no additional treatment required.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment on february 13, 2021, an employee was working to unjam a pelletizer machine when their finger was caught by an auger blade and partially amputated. the machine had been turned off, and a guard was open at the time of the incident.

direct exposure to electricity, unspecified an employee was measuring neutral wire for a new feeder installation when an arc flash occurred, burning the employee's face and hand. the employee was hospitalized.

struck by dislodged flying object, particle an employee was feeding metal into a machine when the metal material kicked back and struck his mid-section, rupturing his colon.

contact with hot objects or substances an employee was using a hot water hose to clean the cook room. he stepped backwards into an open drain trough and the hot water in the drain burned the front of his lower left leg and the top of his left foot. the drain was not covered at the time of the incident.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was doing maintenance on a fence weaver machine. the machine activated, and a rotating shaft caught his hand. his right arm was wrapped around the shaft and suffered multiple fractures.

category: back injury, general injury, lifting or moving loads
text: struck or run over by rolling powered vehicle an excavator was dislodged from a flatbed trailer after hitting an overpass on northbound i-15. an employee attempted to reload the excavator onto the trailer.  the excavator encountered fluid on the flatbed and slipped off the trailer. the employee was injured, sustaining a hairline fracture to the neck vertebrae.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury

category: burns, hand or arm injury, lifting or moving loads
text: contact with hot objects or substances a truck driver along with another employee had just finished draining a tanker. they were unhooking the hose from the tanker when hot liquid asphalt struck the driver's arm causing severe burns. the driver was hospitalized.

ran off driving surface, nonroadway an employee was using a forklift to unload a trailer attached to the cab of a truck. the truck pulled away from the dock and the forklift fell toward the ground. the employee was injured in escaping from the forklift, and was hospitalized.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee experienced an amputation to the right middle finger while clearing a jam from an energized and functional fruit feeder.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was feeding rebar into a cutting machine. it actuated and his hand got stuck in the machine. he suffered broken bones and underwent a surgical amputation.

compressed or pinched between two stationary objects an employee was stepping off a pallet jack to pick a product from the shelf when his right foot was caught between the pallet jack and the upright rack, breaking his right ankle. he was hospitalized and had surgery.

category: general injury, hand or arm injury
text: excavation or trenching cave-in an employee was connecting a pipe to a new manhole inside an excavation when the soil caved in and pinned the employee against the manhole. the employee suffered fractured ribs and shoulder and wrist injuries.

struck by object or equipment, unspecified an employee was working on a milling machine using an overhead crane to flip a bloom bar. the bar struck the employee's legs, causing a laceration and two hairline fractures in his right ankle and left leg.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee unscrewed a platen collar during set-up. the vibration of the thermoformer caused the platen to shift and fall on the employee's finger, amputating the tip (without bone loss).

fall on same level, unspecified an employee was using a fire hose to flush water from a newly installed water line when the hose whipped. the employee tripped or was knocked off balance to the ground by the whipping hose, dislocating the left elbow.

fall on same level due to slipping  an employee was walking from a carwash exit to a detail shop entrance. the employee transitioned from a rock hardscaped island and was stepping down from the curb when he slipped on a steel storm-sewer grate and fell on the surface of the grate. he fractured his left hip.

injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was helping to fabricate a new catwalk when a metal burr went through the employee's glove and into the palm of his right hand, leaving a sliver. he removed the sliver, but the next day his hand and arm became swollen due to an infection. he was hospitalized and required surgery.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was working on a blow mold machine. while he was cleaning out a mixing/blender cylinder, the mixer lacerated his arm. he was hospitalized.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was using a forklift to stack two boxes when her right hand was caught between a box and the forklift forks, resulting in a right index finger amputation.

fall on same level while climbing stairs, steps, or curbs an employee lost his balance and fell while stepping up on a walkway, breaking his hip. he was hospitalized and had surgery.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: fall on same level, n.e.c.  an employee was standing on level ground, stocking cases of tissues. he became lightheaded, lost his balance and fell. he tried to catch himself on a forklift and his right forearm got stuck between a pallet and the forklift backrest. the employee suffered a fractured right forearm and was hospitalized.
exposure through intact skin, eyes, or other exposed tissue an employee was performing maintenance on a customer propane dispenser when he suffered liquid propane burns to his hands.

self-inflicted shooting-unintentional an employee was working at a remote job site delivering chemicals. when he had finished delivering chemicals at that location, he began having a headache. the employee was looking for headache medicine in his backpack and removed a handgun from the backpack placing it on the truck console. when he later reached for the gun it discharged into his left hand. the employee was hospitalized and had surgery.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury

text: other fall to lower level less than 6 feet a lease employee was on an a-frame ladder, testing wires for live electrical service. when he made the tap, he was shocked. he fell about 4 feet onto concrete, breaking his left hip, left scapula, and right shoulder.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet a delivery employee lost his footing while off-loading a crate during a liftgate delivery and fell off the back of the truck approximately 48 inches to the pavement. the employee was hospitalized with broken ribs and punctured lungs.

fall on same level due to slipping  an employee was walking down a sloped paved path in the downhill direction when she tripped and fell, fracturing her left hip. the path was littered with many small pine cones.

entangled in other object or equipment an employee was hanging up a dc electric gun. the employee's foot got tangled up in the gun's power cord, and the resulting twisting/pulling motion caused a broken left hip.

fall on same level due to tripping over an object  a machine operator tripped over the floor-mounted automated palletizer sensor and fell striking his head on the palletizer machine.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee and a coworker were spooling up a steel cable on a winch line when the employee's hand was caught between the sheave and the cable, resulting in the surgical amputation of the right index finger and surgical repair of the third digit.
fall through surface or existing opening, unspecified an employee fell through the roof to the concrete floor, requiring wrist surgery.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was bending a 2-inch by 8-inch piece of metal with a press brake. the brake activated, causing partial amputations to all four fingers on the employee's right hand.

category: hand or arm injury, electric shock or issue, general injury, back injury, fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified on june 7, 2021, an employee was standing on a 6-foot fiberglass step ladder, addressing an issue with a heat pump. the heat pump was turned on to build pressure. while checking the refrigerant in the heat pump, the employee contacted a wire, was shocked, and fell from the ladder. the employee was hospitalized, having suffered electrical burns to the left thumb, index finger, and middle finger, as well as a bruise to the left arm from the fall and neck/back strain.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was operating a horizontal fiber baling unit when the steel door to the baler closed on his left hand, amputating his left thumb tip.

injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was injured while cutting rebar with a quickie saw. the saw kicked backed, striking him on the right side of the face. he was hospitalized and required surgery.
fall on same level due to tripping on uneven surface an employee tripped and fell over a crack on a cement floor, suffering a fractured pelvis.

category: lifting or moving loads, foot or leg injury

injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was doing maintenance on a hydraulic tong. he was using his left index finger to remove water from the top of the tong's ring gear when the machine was activated. the tong began to rotate and pinched his left index finger, partially amputating it.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was strapping cargo in a trailer when he fell from the trailer, landing on the concrete about 48 inches below. he suffered a fractured hip.

vehicle or machinery fire two employees were troubleshooting the starter on a forklift in the maintenance area. while both employees were on opposite ends of the forklift, the second employee pulled the connection tube on the forklift tank. a flash fire occurred. the first employee suffered second degree burns to the face. the second employee suffered second degree burns to the hand/finger and a first degree burn to the forearm. both were hospitalized.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was putting notches in 2x4 wooden boards with a woodcutting notching machine when the machine amputated two middle fingers and part of the pinky finger on the employee's right hand.

category: fall from or working at height issue, general injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee fell from a step ladder to the floor and fractured the right hip.
other jump to lower level, unspecified an employee was injured after jumping off a motorboat and falling into a sluice. the employee had fractures to his ribs and vertebrae.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  on march 29, 2017, an employee was clearing out jammed material in a machine when his hand was caught in the air lock. the rotating fan blades partially amputated his second, third, and fourth fingers on his right hand.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: struck against moving part of machinery or equipment on june 30, 2017, an employee was using a band saw to cut a frozen tube of ground beef into patties when the meat slipped and the employee's right hand contacted the blade, amputating the index finger just below the second knuckle.

category: dropped object or material, weather related issue, lifting or moving loads, foot or leg injury
text: struck by falling object or equipment, n.e.c. an employee was pushing a cart of plywood when a strong wind blew the plywood over, causing the cart to strike and fracture the employee's left ankle.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was replacing a belt on a compressor. the belt caught the employee's finger, causing a deep laceration. the employee was hospitalized for treatment.
